_header: All ye that pass by this holy place
Note:
See Gray (1961)
XGray, Douglas. “A Middle English Epitaph.” Notes and Queries n.s. 8 [206] (1961): 132-5, 135; text immediately follows 3804; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 125.
_description: Tombstone inscription — one stanza rhyme royal

CamTCC366.Transcription:
All ye that passe be thys holy placeBoth spirituall & temporall
                    of euery degreeRemembyr youre selfe well duryng tyme & spaceI was
                    as ye are nowe and I as ye shalbeWherfore I beseche you of youre
                    benygniteffor the love of Ihesu & hys mothyr mareffor my soule to
                    say a pater noster & an aue
CamTCC366.Note: Originally a flyleaf; follows 3804 in same hand.
